intro: Atylus baxteri, commonly known as the Baxter's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a succulent shrub with thick, fleshy leaves and yellow-orange flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Atylus baxteri is noted for its ability to store water in its leaves, making it well adapted to dry conditions.
